entry.title: Hillary Clinton emails to be released in January 2016, says US State Department

entry.title: Hillary and Bill Clinton earned more than $25 million for speeches since 2014

entry.title: Hillary and Bill Clinton earned more than $25 mln for speeches since 2014 -reports
entry.summary: Hillary Clinton, who is the front-runner for the Democratic presidential nomination in 2016, also earned $5 million in royalties for her book, "Hard Choices," which was released in June, according to the newspapers.

entry.title: AP Source: Hillary and Bill Clinton report earning more than $25M from speeches since Jan. '14
entry.summary:
WASHINGTON - Hillary Rodham Clinton and former President Bill Clinton reported Friday they earned more than $25 million combined in speaking fees since January 2014.

The report, required of every candidate for the White House, also shows Hillary Clinton earned more than $5 million from her 2014 memoirs, "Hard Choices."

State Dept: No evidence of conflict in donations to Clinton Foundation, Hillary Clinton's work
entry.summary:
WASHINGTON - The State Department said Monday it has no evidence that any actions taken by Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton when she was secretary of state were influenced by donations to the Clinton Foundation or former President Bill Clinton's speaking fees.

The State Department's comment comes as Hillary Clinton's presidential campaign grapples with criticism that foreign entities traded donations to the family charity for favors at the State Department.

entry.summary:
Washington: As the people of Baltimore set about cleaning up stricken suburbs Hillary Clinton has given her first major policy speech since announcing her candidacy, calling for major criminal justice reform and an end to mass incarceration.

Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton delivers the keynote address at the 18th Annual David N. Dinkins Leadership and Public Policy Forum at Columbia University in New York on Wednesday.

Members of the audience applaud Hillary Rodham Clinton, speaking at Columbia university.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton: Time to "end the era of mass incarceration"
Clinton: Baltimore shows justice system 'out of balance'
entry.summary:
Pointing to a wave of violence in Baltimore, Hillary Rodham Clinton said Wednesday that the nation's criminal justice system has gotten "out of balance" and must be restored through steps such as the use of body cameras by every police department in the country.

Hillary Rodham Clinton, a 2016 Democratic presidential contender, speaks at the David N. Dinkins Leadership and Public Policy Forum, Wednesday, April 29, 2015 in New York.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton's Benghazi emails contain few revelations: sources
entry.summary:
Two people familiar with the material said this week that the 300 emails do not demonstrate that Clinton, who was secretary of state at the time of the attacks, was personally involved in decisions that resulted in weak security at the Benghazi outposts.

The emails show Clinton received updates about the situation in Benghazi after the attacks and about possible U.S. responses, the sources said.

Asked about his role if Hillary Clinton is elected president, Bill Clinton said he would "have to assess what she wants me to do" but "we might have to change the (foundation) rules again."

When Hillary Clinton became President Barack Obama's secretary of state in 2009, the foundation agreed to stop raising money from foreign governments but the Washington Post reported in February that some foreign governments continued to donate while she was in the Obama administration.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton says US-Israel relationship needs to return to 'constructive footing'
entry.summary:
Clinton said the U.S. and Israel need to get back to shared concerns and interests, including a negotiated two-state solution, according to the Conference of Presidents of Major American Jewish Organizations.

"Secretary Clinton thinks we need to all work together to return the special US-Israel relationship to constructive footing," the group's executive vice chairman, Malcolm Hoenlein, said in the statement quoting Clinton's comments.

entry.title: Obama, Hillary Clinton meet privately at the White House
entry.summary: WASHINGTON (AP) - President Barack Obama and Hillary Rodham Clinton met privately at the White House Monday afternoon.

entry.title: Rand Paul urges Clinton to return foreign government money
entry.summary:
MANCHESTER, N.H. (AP) - Sen. Rand Paul on Friday urged Hillary Rodham Clinton to return donations several foreign governments made to her family's philanthropic foundation.

Campaigning in New Hampshire, the Kentucky Republican and likely 2016 presidential candidate said Clinton should give back money from Saudi Arabia, Brunei and the United Arab Emirates because of their "horrific" rejection of women's rights.

Hillary Clinton, who is building a campaign team, remains the leading Democratic presidential contender if she enters the 2016 campaign.

entry.title: Exclusive: Despite Hillary Clinton promise, charity did not disclose donors
entry.summary: A spokesman for Hillary Clinton declined to comment.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton says House GOP budget plan 'fails Americans' on jobs and economy
entry.summary: WASHINGTON - Hillary Rodham Clinton is taking on a tried and true foil - House Republicans - as she prepares for a likely 2016 Democratic presidential campaign.

entry.title: No Record That Hillary Clinton Signed That She Had No Documents
John Boehner to launch new investigation into Hillary Clinton's emails
Clinton Says She Didn't Think Private Email Would Be 'An Issue'
entry.summary: HILLARY CLINTON: Looking back, it would have been better for me to use two separate phones and two email accounts.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton email trove reviewed for release, security
Embattled Hillary Clinton urges State Department to release emails
entry.summary: WASHINGTON, D.C. - A growing controversy over Democrat Hillary Clinton's use of personal email for work while she was U.S. secretary of state could drag on for months, threatening to cloud the expected launch of her 2016 presidential campaign.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton promises to release more emails
entry.summary: "I want the public to see my email. I asked State to release them," according to the tweet from (at)Hillary Clinton.

entry.title: Clinton ran homebrew computer system for official emails
Woman who threw shoe at Hillary Clinton to stay in Arizona
entry.summary:
A woman who threw a shoe at Hillary Rodham Clinton during a speech the former secretary of state made in Las Vegas last April has been sentenced to one year of federal supervision in her home state of Arizona, her defense attorney said.

Clinton was onstage when Ernst threw a soccer shoe toward her.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton email flap puts Democrats in scramble mode
entry.summary:
Hillary Clinton's office insists there was nothing improper about her use of a personal email account during her time as Secretary of State.

Washington: Democrats scrambled on Tuesday to contain the fallout for Hillary Clinton, their favoured 2016 presidential candidate, after allegations she inappropriately used her personal email for work while secretary of state.

Then-Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton speaks at the State Department in Washington in 2012.

Republican Representative Jason Chaffetz of Utah said the House Oversight Committee, which he chairs, will work with the Benghazi committee "to further explore Hillary Clinton's use of personal emails while at the State Department."

entry.title: Hillary Clinton used private e-mail for State Department business
entry.summary: "Hillary Clinton should release her e-mails. Hopefully she hasn't already destroyed them," said Bush spokeswoman Kristy Campbell.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton may have broken federal record-keeping laws
Hillary Clinton used personal email account for all government business report claims
entry.summary: Former US secretary of state Hillary Clinton may have violated federal records laws by using a personal email account for all of her work messages, the New York Times reported on Monday.

entry.title: Clinton emails at State Department draw scrutiny
entry.summary:
Hillary Rodham Clinton exclusively used a personal email account to conduct government business as secretary of state, State Department officials said, and may have violated federal requirements that officials' correspondence be retained as part of the agency's record.

A spokesman for Clinton, Nick Merrill, defended her use of the personal email account and said she has been complying with the "letter and spirit of the rules."
